keyword: how many calories are in mandarin oranges
title: How Many Calories Are in Mandarin Oranges?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in mandarin oranges, including carbs, fiber, sugars, protein, and full nutrition per serving, plus tweaks and FAQs.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Mandarin Oranges?
assumptions: Fresh, medium-sized (about 88g each), peeled, no added sugar or preservatives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by size, variety, ripeness, and preparation; canned or processed versions differ. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One medium mandarin orange provides about 47 kcal, mostly from natural sugars.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Canned in light syrup (drained, per orange)
Dried mandarin segments (rehydrated to fresh equivalent)

faqs.q: How many calories are in one mandarin orange?
faqs.a: About 47 kcal for one medium fresh mandarin orange.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in mandarin oranges?
faqs.a: One medium orange has ~11.7 g carbs, including 1.8 g fiber and 10 g sugars.

faqs.q: Do mandarin oranges have protein or fat?
faqs.a: Minimal: ~0.7 g protein and 0.3 g fat per medium orange.

faqs.q: How do canned mandarin oranges compare in calories?
faqs.a: Canned in syrup adds 10-25 kcal per orange due to added sugars; juice-packed is closer to fresh.

faqs.q: Are mandarin oranges low in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, only ~2 mg sodium per fresh medium orange, making them heart-friendly.
